arts.ttl: Silva enjoyed 'brave' Fulham as they comfortably beat Brentford
arts.sum: Fulham manager Marco Silva says his side were the 'best team on the pitch' as they comfortably beat Brentford, winning 3-1 at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Iwobi stars as Fulham come from behind to beat Brentford in West London derby
arts.sum: Fulham come from behind to record a 3-1 victory over Brentford in Saturday night's West London derby at Craven Cottage.

arts.ttl: Brentford bested in commanding derby win for Fulham
arts.sum: A terrific comeback victory at the Cottage makes it two in a row for Silva's men

arts.ttl: Brentford 'need to address performance levels' - Andrews on Fulham loss
arts.sum: Brentford manager Keith Andrews admitted his side "lacked quality" as they were beaten 3-1 at West London rivals Fulham in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Dominant Fulham come from behind to ease past Brentford
arts.sum: Alex Iwobi scores one goal and sets up another as Fulham come from behind to beat West London rivals Brentford 3-1 in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Alex Iwobi inspires Fulham’s rousing comeback win against Brentford
arts.sum: Fulham showed their teeth under the floodlights here and, given these are footballers we are talking about, the results were decidedly gleaming. Goals from Alex Iwobi and Harry Wilson plus an Ethan Pinnock own goal enabled Marco Silva’s men to bounce back from an early concession to take three points with something to spare. In claiming the spoils once again in this west London derby, Fulham also took some of the shine off Keith Andrews’ start as Brentford manager in the process. Silva had used his programme notes to remind supporters of the atmosphere created at the corresponding fixture last season – a 2-1 Fulham win secured by two Wilson goals in second-half added time. “Matches under the lights at the Cottage can be special,” he wrote, adding: “In both our matches against Brentford last season, the players needed to show a lot of character.” It duly came to pass that every pre-match observation made by the canny Silva was manifest again here. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wilson stars again as Fulham see off Brentford in west London derby
arts.sum: Harry Wilson once again helped Fulham to come from behind to beat Brentford at Craven Cottage with the hosts' 3-1 victory setting up a second win in a week.

arts.ttl: Iwobi stars as Fulham beat Brentford
arts.sum: Alex Iwobi caps a dynamic display with a goal and an assist as Fulham come from behind against Brentford to secure their second Premier League win of the season.
